meanings.definition: To clean or groom an animal, especially a horse.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy fetting my dog every weekend to keep her fur shiny.
meanings.sent2: The stable hand spent the morning fetting the horses before the big race.
meanings.sent3: After fetting the cat, it looked like a fluffy ball of happiness.
meanings.sent4: She approached the task of fetting the horse with the precision of a surgeon.
meanings.sent5: The young girl learned the art of fetting from her grandmother, who was a skilled horse groomer.

meanings.definition: To prepare or arrange something, typically in a meticulous or detailed manner.
meanings.sent1: She was fetting the table for the dinner party, making sure everything was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The chef was busy fetting the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent3: He spent hours fetting his outfit for the job interview, wanting to make a good impression.
meanings.sent4: The event planner was fetting every detail of the wedding, ensuring it would be flawless.
meanings.sent5: The artist was fetting the colors on his palette, getting ready to create a masterpiece.
